Description: Fragment of oval handle to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-red; cream slip. Circular stamp with rose symbol.
Production date: 165 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Ink '82' (registration number, in error) and, deleted, '19̣0̣'. Name Archilaidas. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 103.36.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (89)
